channel.title: Torch Up: Brood War AI Tournament - Spacebeam Community

item.title: Brood War AI Tournament RFC 2
item.description:
Torch Up: Brood War AI Tournament is currently organized by the Spacebeam community as annual FOSDEM side event (end of January/beginning of February).

The results are presented at FOSDEM in Brussels, Belgium.

All bots play several round-robins, with a second stage or knock-out matches between the top 4. The …
item.dc:creator: Spacebeam Community

item.title: Brood War AI Tournament RFC 1
item.description:
Current StarCraft: Brood War AI tournaments claim to be using Windows because that is the OS that the game was written for 20 years ago, they want to keep things as close to the original game environment as possible.

Organizers argue that anything you write from Linux should also compile …
item.dc:creator: Spacebeam Community

item.title: The Undermind podcast 33
item.description: It was great to hear again from Johan de Jong the author of BananaBrain one of the top competitive protoss bots, he talked about his work around Dark Templar and Reaver/Shuttle micro as well as goin into details about his development process and path-finding fixed issues, BananaBrain was 5th …
